message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.CY 

This paper deals with analyzing social media data, specifically Twitter, to gain insights into public opinion on political and public policy issues. This falls under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL) as it involves natural language processing techniques to analyze tweets. Additionally, the paper proposes a semi-supervised framework for identifying users with differing opinions, which involves machine learning and data mining techniques, making it relevant to sub-categories such as social and information networks (cs.SI), data structures and algorithms (cs.SD), and computational social science (cs.SOC). Finally, the paper also deals with issues of privacy and ethics in social media data analysis, which could fall under the sub-category of cybersecurity (cs.CY).
